importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication reflects the timing of Doug Martin's death, which is central to the news event.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame spans Martin's NFL career from the 2012 draft through his final seasons, illustrating the duration of his professional involvement in the league.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft after a standout college career at Boise State.
He earned Pro Bowl honors in 2015 with 1,402 yards rushing and six touchdowns, and was named first-team All-Pro.
Martin finished his career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns over six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
He also caught 148 passes for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers publicly mourned his passing, calling it a 'sudden and unexpected' loss and stating he made a 'lasting impact' on the franchise.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in franchise history during the team's 50th anniversary celebration.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36. Selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft from Boise State, Martin had a standout career including Pro Bowl honors in 2015 and first-team All-Pro recognition. He accumulated 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns over seven seasons, including one with the Raiders. The Buccaneers acknowledged his lasting impact on the franchise and named him among the top 50 players in team history during their 50th anniversary celebration.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
